text: I'm the director of the digital
transformation hub at Cal Poly and I'm
also the director of new programs our
relationship with AWS has allowed us to
give students access to cloud
technologies in their classes so they
can apply things like artificial
intelligence and image recognition and
IOT to the projects they're working on
it's not so much that everything is
theoretical now they can actually learn
by doing in the classroom the cal poly
digital transformation hub
also known as the DX hub provides
students with the opportunity to work on
real-world problems using proven
innovation techniques and then we allow
them to work with public sector agencies
which have deep subject matter expertise
and could involve things like
homelessness climate change water
resource issues a human trafficking what
we are able to do is provide our
students with access to the latest
technologies almost as soon as they come
out we have students who are working on
an evidence-based policing program that
the police department will use in the
future our students come up with ideas
that we would never have thought of
before we're using products like Amazon
recognition to identify automatically
what seafloor species are data analytics
is a big area that we focus on we have
some researchers in psychology who
analyze brain scans and it was taking
them three and four days to analyze the
brain scan in the past they can now do
it in two or three hours we're
integrating the technology capabilities
with the learning process on campus
which gives our students a different
perspective so as we move into the
future the cloud enables us to move much
more quickly to be far more innovative
we can try ideas that we've never could
have done before because we can spin up
a server try the processing that we
thought we needed to do and if it fails
that's ok we can upgrade our systems we
can
move into newer technologies we can
apply more advanced technologies to
problems much more quickly than we could
before
